articleinfo.title: LEHD Public Use Data Schema for J2J Explorer (beta) V4.2-rc1

important.title: Important
important.simpara: This document is not an official Census Bureau publication. It is compiled from publicly accessible information by Lars Vilhuber (Labor Dynamics Institute, Cornell University). Feedback is welcome. Please write us at lars.vilhuber@cornell.edu.

section.title: Purpose
section.simpara: The public-use Job-to-Job Flows (J2J) data provided by the Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics Program are accessible through the J2J Explorer (beta). This document provides information on the schema used to format files downloaded through that application.

section.title: Additional information
section.simpara: The complete LEHD schema is documented in lehd_public_use_schema.pdf. LEHD-provided SHP files are separately described in lehd_shapefiles.pdf. The naming conventions of the data files is documented in lehd_csv_naming.pdf.

section.title: Extends
section.simpara: This is the first version of the schema for the J2J Explorer (beta) application.

section.title: Supersedes
section.simpara: No prior version.

section.title: Basic Schema
section.simpara: Each data file is structured as a CSV file. The first columns contain , subsequent columns contain , followed by status flags.

section.title: Generic structure
section.simpara: Note: The J2J Explorer (beta) provides the full set of J2J indicators in addition to two composite Origin-Destination indicators. Files downloadable through other means may be structured differently, please consult the complete LEHD schema in lehd_public_use_schema.pdf.

section.title: Identifiers
section.simpara: Records, unless otherwise noted, are parts of time-series data. Unique record identifiers are noted below, by file type. Identifiers without the year and quarter component can be considered a series identifier.

section.title: Identifiers for j2j
section.simpara: ( lehd_identifiers_j2j.csv )

entry.simpara: Group: Geographic level of aggregation of destination job

Group: Firm Size group of origin job

section.title: Indicators
section.simpara: The following tables and associated mapping files list the indicators available on each file. The 'Indicator Variable' is the short name of the variable on the CSV files, suitable for machine processing in a wide variety of statistical applications. When given, the 'Alternate name' may appear in related documentation and articles. The 'Status Flag' is used to indicate publication or data quality status (see Status Flags). The 'Indicator Name' is a more verbose name for the indicator. The 'Description' provides a complete description of the indicator. 'Units' identify the type of variable: counts, rates, monetary amounts. 'Concept' classifies each indicator in a descriptive category: employment, hire, separation, earnings, or flow. The 'Base' indicates the denominator used to compute the statistic, and may be 1.
( variables_j2japp.csv )

entry.simpara: Job flows with a short or no observed nonemployment spell
Job flows from stable employment into stable employment with a short or no observed nonemployment spell
Average Earnings prior to Job-to-Job Flows
Average quarterly earnings prior to job flows with a short or no observed nonemployment spell
Average quarterly earnings following job flows with a short or no observed nonemployment spell

section.title: Categorical Variables
section.simpara: Categorical variable descriptions are displayed above each table, with the variable name shown in parentheses. Unless otherwise stated, every possible value/label combination for each categorical variable is listed. Please note that not all values will be available in every table.

section.title: Industry
section.simpara: ( label_industry.csv )

Only a small subset of available values shown. The 2017 NAICS (North American Industry Classification System) is used for all years. QWI releases prior to R2018Q1 used the 2012 NAICS classification (see Schema v4.1.3). For a full listing of all valid 2017 NAICS codes, see http://www.census.gov/cgi-bin/sssd/naics/naicsrch?chart=2017.

section.title: Geographic levels
section.simpara: Geography labels for data files are provided in separate files, by scope. Each file label_geograpy_SCOPE.csv may contain one or more types of records as flagged by geo_level. For convenience, a composite file containing all geocodes is available as label_geography.csv. The 2017 vintage of Census TIGER/Line geography is used for all tabulations as of the R2018Q1 release.
Shapefiles are described in a separate document.
( label_geo_level.csv )

entry.simpara: Identifies 5-digit CBSA code for metropolitan areas provided by the Census Bureau’s Geography Division. Balance of state including micropolitan areas are identified by custom codes as [ST]999
Identifies 7-digit code constructed from the 2-digit state FIPS code and the 5-digit CBSA code provided by the Census Bureau’s Geography Division
Custom code using 00 to denote national scope
2-digit state FIPS code and the 6-digit WIA identifier provided by LED State Partners

section.title: National and state-level values
section.simpara: ( label_fipsnum.csv )
The file label_fipsnum.csv contains values and labels for all entities of geo_level N or S, and is a summary of separately available files.

section.title: Detailed state and substate level values
section.simpara: Note: cross-state CBSA, in records of type geo_level = M, are present on files of type label_geography_XX.csv. A particular cross-state CBSA will appear on multiple files.

section.title: Aggregation level
section.simpara: ( label_agg_level.csv )

Measures within the J2J and QWI data products are tabulated on many different dimensions, including demographic characteristics, geography, industry, and other firm characteristics. For Origin-Destination (O-D) tables, characteristics of the origin and destination firm can be tabulated separately. Every tabulation level is assigned a unique aggregation index, represented by the agg_level variable. This index starts from 1, representing a national level grand total (all industries, workers, etc.), and progresses through different combinations of characteristics. There are gaps in the progression to leave space for aggregation levels that may be included in future data releases.
agg_level is currently reported only for J2J data products.
The following variables are included in the label_agg_level.csv file:

entry.simpara: index representing level of aggregation reported on a given record
firm characteristics reported on record. These will be the characteristics of the destination firm in O-D tabulations
characteristics of origin firm reported on record (O-D tabulations only)
Flag: Aggregation level available on J2J counts tables
Flag: Aggregation level available on J2J rates tables
Flag: Aggregation level available on J2J O-D tables
Flag: Aggregation level available on QWI

section.simpara: The characteristics available on an aggregation level are repeated using a series of flags following the standard schema:

listitem.simpara: by_ variables - flags indicating other dimensions reported, including ownership, demographics, firm age and size.

section.simpara: A shortened representation of the file is provided below, the complete file is available in the link above.

section.title: Status flags
section.simpara: ( label_flags.csv )
Each status flag in the tables above contains one of the following valid values. The values and their interpretation are listed in the table below.

important.title: Important
important.simpara: Note: Currently, the J2J tables only contain status flags -1, 1, 5. Status flags with values 10 or above only appear in online applications, not in CSV files.

entry.simpara: no data available in this category for this quarter
data not available to compute this estimate
Value suppressed because it does not meet US Census Bureau publication standards.
Value calculated from other released measures - no significant distortion
Value calculated from other released measures - some of which have significantly distorted data
Data significantly distorted - fuzzed value released
Aggregate of cells - no significant distortion
Aggregate of cells not released because component cells do not meet U.S. Census Bureau publication standards
Aggregate of cells - some of which have significantly distorted data

section.title: Metadata
section.simpara: ( variables_version.csv )

section.title: Version Metadata for J2J Files (version.txt)
section.simpara: Each data release is accompanied by one or more files with metadata on geographic and temporal coverage, in a compact notation. These files follow the following naming convention:
where each component is described in more detail in lehd_csv_naming.pdf.
The contents contains the following elements:

entry.simpara: (optional - concatenated with product) used for QWI to distinguish separate tabulations from the legal [demo]_[fas] combinations as described in lehd_csv_naming.pdf
Covered (uppercase state postal code including entire nation or the word METRO)
Release quarter (identifies when the data was created)
Internal identifier used for provenance tracking

section.simpara: For instance, the metadata for the R2017Q3 release of "Missouri" "Kokomo J2J tabulations (obtained from here) has the following content:
Some J2J metadata may contain multiple lines, as necessary.

section.title: Additional Metadata for J2JOD Files (avail.csv)
section.simpara: (variables_avail.csv)
Because the origin-destination (J2JOD) data link two regions, we provide an auxiliary file with the time range that cells containing data for each geographic pairing may appear in a data release.

entry.simpara: First year regional pair may be observed
First quarter regional pair may be observed
Last year regional pair may be observed
Last quarter regional pair may be observed

section.simpara: The reference region will always be either the origin or the destination. National tabulations contain records where both origin and destination are geo_level=N; state tabulations contain records where geo_level in (N,S); metro tabulations contain records where geo_level in (N,S,B). Data may be suppressed for certain combinations of regions and quarters because the estimates do not meet Census Bureau publication standards.

section.title: Metadata on Indicator Availability
section.simpara: (variables_lags.csv)

Each Indicator potentially requires leads and/or lags of data to be computed, and thus may not be available for certain time periods. The date range for J2J and J2JR can be found in version.txt; the date range for J2JOD can be found in avail.csv.
For each indicator, the following files contain the quarters of data required to be available relative to the overall date range described in the metadata for the release:
The files are structured as follows:

entry.simpara: Number of quarters of data required to compute indicator relative to start quarter
Number of quarters of data required to compute indicator relative to end quarter
